data.title: Intuit on LinkedIn: Every year, Intuit employees participate in our Global Week of Service…
data.meta_description: Every year, Intuit employees participate in our Global Week of Service, where they give back to local communities in personally meaningful ways. Here are just… | 31 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
Intuit’s Ashok Srivastava understands that clean data is crucial for quality #AI outcomes for customers. “Our data is cleaner now than it ever has been before. We are using AI to actually monitor the quality of the data and other aspects of the data, and let data producers know if there’s a problem.” –SVP and Chief Data Officer Ashok Srivastava Read more on Fast Company ⬇ Intuit Mailchimp Shivang Shah

Intuit Mailchimp Rotational Product Manager intern Eileen Kang has gained invaluable insight into the world of entrepreneurship by managing her successful jewelry-making side hustle, Kinaesthetics Studio. “It’s taught me the sheer amount of skills a small business owner has to learn, manage, and master to achieve their goals. Not only do you have to create an excellent, unique product, you also have to work on marketing and keeping track of finances to make sure everything’s running smoothly.” Read Eileen’s story on Intuit Blog ⬇️

“It’s impactful to know that you’re not a stranger, in the company of others who understand who you are and respect who you are.” Hear from members of the Intuit Pride Network about the importance of having communities in the workplace that support and celebrate the LGBTQIA+ community.

That’s a wrap on Toronto’s 2024 Collision Conf! Check out the highlights from the week: 💥 Intuit’s Chief Procurement Officer Emma Chontos and NFL star Ndamukong Suh chatted onstage about their playbooks for investing in financial literacy and the importance of financial education. 💥 Our innovative AI and tech work was showcased during Collision’s masterclasses led by Greg Coulombe and Kamalika Das, PhD. 💥 A full house at our Toronto office gathered to listen to Intuit’s David Thompson and others at the BetaKit Talks: AI in Action panel. They covered key topics impacting the technology ecosystem with Canadian #AI innovators. #CDNtech #CollisionConf

Intuit VP of Global Data Krithika Swaminathan's career journey is a testament to the power of resilience, curiosity, and continuous learning in the engineering field. Here is some advice she recently shared with emerging women engineers and aspiring leaders: 🚪 Embrace opportunities: “Go through the door when it opens for you.” The fear of failure shouldn't hold you back. Every challenge is a stepping stone to greater learning and success. 🥇 Build trust and respect: Your team members are humans too. Adopt a “help me, help you" mindset to cultivate a culture of trust and deliver better results as a team. 🌐 Find mentors and sponsors: Mentors and sponsors provide guidance, advocate on your behalf, and help you navigate the complexities of your career path. Make your work stand out and give others ample reason to support you. 👐 Lead with authenticity: Be bold, ask for help when needed, and don’t be afraid to show vulnerability. Authentic leadership inspires and attracts others to want to work with you. To read Krithika’s full story, visit the Intuit Blog. #INWED24

Our Intuit IDEAS program is now in Atlanta, Los Angeles, and Philadelphia. Intuit is providing small business owners with new financial technology and expert advice. At the end of the program, we'll also give each business owner $5,000 to help them grow. Applications are now open and interested businesses can apply with Urban League of Greater Atl, Los Angeles Urban League, and Urban League of Philadelphia.
